description: Triangle of number of permutations of {1, 2, ..., n} having exactly k cycles, each of which is of length >=r for r=3.
comments: Generalizes Stirling numbers of the first kind
references: L. Comtet, Advanced Combinatorics, Reidel, 1974, p. 257.
links: S. Brassesco, M. A. Méndez, The asymptotic expansion for the factorial and Lagrange inversion formula, arXiv:1002.3894v1 [math.CA]
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Permutation Cycle.
mathematica: t[n_ /; n >= 3, k_ /; k >= 1] := t[n, k] = (n - 1)*t[n - 1, k] + (n - 2)*(n - 1)*t[n - 3, k - 1] ; t[_, _] = 0; t[3, 1] = 2; Flatten[ Table[t[n, k], {n, 3, 15}, {k, 1, Floor[n/3]}]] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 05 2012, after _Peter Bala_ *)
author: _Eric W. Weisstein_
